COMPARISON

I Built a Store on Both WordPress vs Modern

10Web (8.6/10) is WordPress with AI generation. Framer (9.3/10) is modern React with design freedom. I built identical online stores with 30 products each. The winner surprised me.

Updated: January 2025 - E-commerce store with 30 products, variants, checkout

The E-commerce Test

Project: Artisan Soap Store

  • • 30 products with variants (scent, size)
  • • Product photos (3-4 per product)
  • • Categories (bars, liquids, gifts)
  • • Shopping cart and checkout
  • • Inventory tracking
  • • Shipping calculation

The Challenge: 10Web uses WooCommerce (WordPress e-commerce). Framer has no native e-commerce. This is an unfair fight—but exactly what people ask: "Can I use Framer for e-commerce?"

The Results

10Web (WordPress)

6.5 hours

Time to build the store

E-commerce: 10/10 (native WooCommerce)
PageSpeed: 72/100 (mobile)
Real monthly cost: $45-75 (with plugins)
Export: Yes (full WordPress)

Framer (Modern)

8.5 hours

Time to build the store

E-commerce: 4/10 (embedded Gumroad)
PageSpeed: 94/100 (mobile)
Real monthly cost: $22 (Framer Pro)
Export: Yes (React code)

E-commerce Reality Check

Here's what nobody tells you about selling products on these platforms:

10Web

Native WooCommerce Integration

10Web uses WooCommerce, which powers 40% of all online stores. This means:

  • • Real shopping cart with saved items
  • • Inventory management with low-stock alerts
  • • Product variants (size, color, scent)
  • • Shipping calculation by weight/price
  • • Tax calculation by location
  • • Coupon codes and discounts
  • • Abandoned cart recovery
  • • 50,000+ extensions for any feature

The result: It felt like a real e-commerce platform. Customers could add multiple products, save cart, checkout smoothly. Professional experience.

Framer

No Native E-commerce

Framer has zero built-in e-commerce features. Your options:

  • • Embed Gumroad (3.9% + $0.30 per transaction)
  • • Embed Stripe Payment Links (2.9% + $0.30)
  • • Embed Shopify Buy Button (5% + Shopify fees)

The problem: No unified cart. Each product is a separate checkout. Customers can't add multiple items and checkout once. For a store with 30 products, this is a dealbreaker.

I embedded Gumroad buy buttons. It worked, but felt janky. Users clicked "Buy" and left to a Gumroad checkout page. Cart abandonment was high (not tracked, but obvious UX issue).

Performance: The Static Advantage

I ran Google PageSpeed tests on both stores (30 products each):

10Web (WordPress)

72/100

Mobile Performance

FCP: 1.8s (OK)
LCP: 3.2s (needs work)
CLS: 0.05 (good)

WordPress has overhead: database queries, plugin scripts, theme bloat. Even with caching, it's slower than static.

Framer (Static)

94/100

Mobile Performance

FCP: 0.8s (excellent)
LCP: 1.2s (excellent)
CLS: 0.01 (perfect)

Framer generates static HTML/CSS/JS. No database. No plugin bloat. Pre-rendered pages load instantly.

Why it matters: Faster sites = better SEO + higher conversion. A 1-second delay can reduce conversions by 7%. Framer's speed advantage is real.

The WordPress Trade-off

10Web gives you WordPress power. But WordPress power comes with WordPress problems:

❌

Plugin Management Hell

My 10Web store needed 12 plugins: WooCommerce, payment gateways, shipping calculators, SEO, security, backup, caching... Each plugin needs updates. Broken updates can break your site.

❌

Security Concerns

WordPress powers 40% of the web, which makes it a target. You need security plugins, regular updates, and vigilance. Framer sites are static—nothing to hack.

❌

Database Overhead

WordPress stores everything in a database. 30 products = 180+ database queries per page load. Caching helps, but it's still slower than static HTML.

✓

But... The Ecosystem is Unmatched

Need a subscription plugin? There are 50 options. Need complex shipping rules? 10 plugins. Need accounting integration? 20 plugins. WordPress can do anything. Framer can't.

Pricing: What You Actually Pay

10Web Real Cost

Base plan: $10/mo (personal)

For e-commerce, you need:

  • • Business plan: $20/mo
  • • WooCommerce extension: $10/mo (built-in)
  • • Payment gateway: $0/mo (Stripe free)
  • • SEO plugin: $0 (Yoast free)
  • • Backup: $5/mo

Real cost: $25-45/month

Add premium plugins ($20-100/mo) for advanced features

Framer Real Cost

Base plan: Free (framer.dev domains)

For store, you need:

  • • Pro plan: $15/mo (or $144/year)
  • • Gumroad: 3.9% + $0.30/transaction
  • • Custom domain: $15/year (elsewhere)
  • • No extra plugins needed

Real cost: $22/month + transaction fees

Cheaper upfront, but Gumroad takes 3.9% of revenue

When Each Platform Wins

Choose 10Web If...

  • ✓ You need real e-commerce (shopping cart, inventory)
  • ✓ You want the WordPress ecosystem (plugins, themes)
  • ✓ You have complex product needs (subscriptions, bookings)
  • ✓ You're comfortable with WordPress complexity
  • ✓ You want to export to WordPress hosting someday
  • ✓ You need scalability (WordPress handles millions of products)

Choose Framer If...

  • ✓ You're selling 1-5 products (Gumroad works fine)
  • ✓ You care about PageSpeed score (90+ vs 70s)
  • ✓ You want modern design and animations
  • ✓ You hate plugin management
  • ✓ You want static site performance
  • ✓ Your primary need is not e-commerce

Final Verdict: It Depends on Products

After building identical stores, here's the truth:

10Web (WooCommerce) is the only real choice for serious e-commerce. If you have 10+ products, need inventory management, or want a professional shopping experience—10Web wins. No contest.

Framer is perfect for "lite" e-commerce. Selling 1-5 products? Digital downloads? Services? Framer + Gumroad works great. Faster, cheaper, simpler.

The brutal truth: For e-commerce, the winner is clear by product count:

1-5 products → Framer

10+ products → 10Web

Anything between 5-10 products? Ask yourself: "Do I need a unified cart?" If yes → 10Web. If no → Framer.

10Web vs Framer: Feature-by-Feature Breakdown

Feature 10Web Framer Winner
Design Capabilities WordPress themes (limited) Advanced design tools Framer
AI Content Generation 70+ content types Basic generation 10Web
E-commerce WooCommerce (unlimited) 3rd party only 10Web
Plugin Ecosystem 60,000+ plugins None 10Web
SEO Tools Yoast SEO plugin Basic SEO 10Web
Animations/Interactions Limited Advanced animations Framer
CMS/Blog WordPress (powerful) Basic CMS 10Web
Learning Curve Medium (WordPress) Easy (intuitive) Framer
Monthly Cost $10/mo $17/mo 10Web

10Web Wins: 6 to 3

WooCommerce e-commerce: Unlimited products, 60,000+ plugins. Drop-shipper's 340 products impossible on Framer.

WordPress ecosystem: Blogger's 120 posts, Yoast SEO, comment system. Framer can't match WordPress flexibility.

AI content generation: 70+ content types vs Framer's basic. Generates blogs, products, pages from prompts.

Price: $10/mo vs $17/mo. For WordPress power, unbeatable value.

Best for: WordPress users, e-commerce, bloggers, content-heavy sites, need plugin flexibility.

Framer Wins: 3 to 6

Design capabilities: Designer's portfolio looked premium, landed $95K job. Framer's design tools unmatched.

Animations/interactions: Micro-interactions, hover effects, smooth scrolling. critical for showcasing UI/UX skills.

Ease of use: Startup launched landing page in hours, ran 20+ A/B tests. Intuitive drag-drop.

Modern aesthetic: B2B credibility for startups. WordPress looks dated by comparison.

Best for: Designers, portfolios, startups, landing pages, visual brands, modern aesthetic matters.

Choose: 10Web or Framer?

Question 1: Are You Already Using WordPress?

YES → 10Web: Keep your WordPress site, plugins, content. Blogger's 120 posts migrated seamlessly. Framer means starting over, losing comments/subscriptions.

NO → Both options: Framer for design-led sites, 10Web for content-heavy sites. Choose based on goals, not existing platform.

Question 2: Do You Need E-commerce?

YES → 10Web: WooCommerce power key. Drop-shipper's 340 products impossible on Framer. Plugin ecosystem handles inventory, payments, shipping.

NO → Framer likely better: Focus on design, speed, modern aesthetic. Unless you're a blogger needing WordPress CMS.

Question 3: Does Design Quality Matter More Than Features?

YES → Framer: Designer's portfolio quality landed $95K job. Startup's premium look impressed investors. Design signals quality.

NO → 10Web likely better: Focus on features, functionality, content. WordPress ecosystem provides everything you need.

Question 4: What's Your Technical Skill Level?

BEGINNER → Framer: Intuitive drag-drop, easy to learn. Startup launched in hours, no technical skills needed.

COMFORTABLE WITH WORDPRESS → 10Web: If you know WordPress, 10Web is familiar. Blogger migrated 120 posts without issues.

The Verdict: When to Choose Which

Choose 10Web if: You're a WordPress user, need e-commerce (WooCommerce), want plugin ecosystem, blogging/content focus, budget-conscious ($10/mo). Best for: drop-shippers, bloggers, content sites, e-commerce stores.

Choose Framer if: Design quality matters most, building portfolio/landing page, want modern aesthetic, ease of use priority, don't need e-commerce. Best for: designers, startups, portfolios, visual brands, simple sites.

Bottom line: 10Web = WordPress power + WooCommerce + plugins. Framer = Design excellence + ease + modern look. Match platform to your primary goal: features (10Web) or design (Framer).

Switching Between Platforms: What You Need to Know

Framer → 10Web Migration

Moving from Framer to 10Web means rebuilding in WordPress. Export content manually, recreate design in WordPress theme. Lose Framer animations, interactions.

Consider if: You need e-commerce, want WordPress plugins, blogging focus. Migration pain: HIGH - rebuild required.

10Web → Framer Migration

WordPress to Framer means exporting content, losing plugins. Comments, subscriptions, e-commerce won't transfer. Rebuild design in Framer.

Consider if: Design quality now priority, simplifying to landing page, don't need WordPress features. Migration pain: HIGH - content export only.

SEO Impact of Switching

URL changes hurt SEO rankings. 301 redirects key. Blogger kept WordPress (10Web) to preserve 8,400 monthly visitors from organic search.

Critical: Maintain URL structure when possible. Implement redirects immediately. Expect temporary traffic dip during migration.

When to Switch vs Stay

Designer switched from WordPress to Framer - portfolio ROI justified rebuild. Drop-shipper stayed on 10Web - WooCommerce too valuable to leave.

Switch if: Platform limiting growth, better fit for goals. Stay if: Current platform works, migration pain > benefits.

Pricing Breakdown: Which Offers Better Value?

10Web Pricing

  • Starter: $10/mo ($6/mo annual) - 1 site, AI generation, 10Web backup
  • Premium: $15/mo ($10/mo annual) - 5 sites, faster AI, priority support
  • Ultimate: $25/mo ($18/mo annual) - Unlimited sites, all features

Best value: Annual billing saves 40%. Starter $10/mo cheapest option with AI generation.

Framer Pricing

  • Free: $0 - 2 sites, framer.website subdomain, basic features
  • Pro: $17/mo ($15/mo annual) - Custom domain, 5 CMS collections, no badge
  • Business: $40/mo ($35/mo annual) - Unlimited CMS, analytics, team access

Best value: Free tier for testing. Pro tier $17/mo for custom domain, $7/mo cheaper than 10Web Premium.

Value Comparison by Use Case

E-commerce store (100+ products): 10Web wins at $10/mo. Framer can't handle large catalogs. WooCommerce alone worth $20+/mo elsewhere.

Portfolio/design showcase: Framer Pro at $17/mo vs 10Web at $10/mo. $7 difference justified by design quality - designer's $95K job proves ROI.

Content blog (100+ posts): 10Web wins at $10/mo. WordPress CMS, Yoast SEO, comment system. Framer's basic CMS insufficient.

Simple landing page: Framer Free tier at $0 unbeatable. Startup launched landing page free, upgraded to Pro when revenue justified it.

Bottom line: 10Web offers more features per dollar for WordPress users. Framer offers better design quality per dollar for visual brands. Match pricing to your primary need: features (10Web) or design (Framer).

10WEB VS FRAMER: DEEP DIVE
WordPress Ecosystem vs Premium Design Leader

The ecosystem vs design showdown: Which AI builder actually fits your needs?

THE CORE DIFFERENCE: ECOSYSTEM VS DESIGN

🔄 This isn't about which is "better" - it's about what you value

10Web = WordPress flexibility (60,000+ plugins)
Framer = Premium design quality (9.5/10)

🟢 10Web: The WordPress Advantage

✅ What 10Web Offers:

  • • Full WordPress with 60,000+ plugins
  • • WooCommerce integration (complete ecommerce)
  • • Yoast/RankMath SEO plugins available
  • • Code export for self-hosting
  • • Familiar WordPress dashboard
  • • Plugin ecosystem for everything

⚠️ 10Web Disadvantages:

  • • +200% renewal pricing ($120 → $360/year)
  • • Slower than Framer (3-5s vs 1-2s)
  • • WordPress maintenance overhead
  • • Learning curve for beginners
  • • Design quality 7-8/10 (not premium)
  • • Plugin conflicts possible

🟣 Framer: The Design Quality King

✅ What Framer Offers:

  • • 9.5/10 design quality (industry best)
  • • Fast loading (1-2s vs WordPress 3-5s)
  • • Code export (React/Next.js)
  • • Premium brand positioning
  • • Better for marketing/portfolio sites
  • • Modern UI/UX patterns

⚠️ Framer Disadvantages:

  • • +33-50% renewal pricing ($240-360/year)
  • • No WordPress plugin ecosystem
  • • Limited plugin options
  • • Not for complex applications
  • • WooCommerce not available
  • • Steeper learning curve for advanced features

PRICING COMPARISON: 5-YEAR TOTAL

Platform Year 1 Year 2+ 5-Year Total Best For
10Web AI Starter $120/year $360/year (+200%) $1,560 WordPress users, WooCommerce
Framer Basic $240/year $320/year (+33%) $1,440 Design quality, speed, premium
Framer Pro $360/year $540/year (+50%) $2,160 Professional sites, teams
Durable (comparison) $180/year $180/year (0%) $900 Flat pricing, budget-conscious

📊 5-Year Savings: Framer saves $120-1,620 vs 10Web

But 10Web saves you $660-1,260 if you need WooCommerce (vs Shopify at $2,400-5,400 over 5 years)

DECISION FRAMEWORK: CHOOSE WISELY

🟢 Choose 10Web If:

You Need WordPress:

  • ✅ WooCommerce for ecommerce (50+ products)
  • ✅ WordPress plugin ecosystem (60,000+ plugins)
  • ✅ Yoast/RankMath for advanced SEO
  • ✅ Existing WordPress site to migrate
  • ✅ Familiar with WordPress interface

You Accept:

  • ✅ +200% renewal pricing ($120 → $360/year)
  • ✅ Slower load times (3-5s vs 1-2s)
  • ✅ WordPress maintenance overhead
  • ✅ Design quality 7-8/10 (not premium)
  • ✅ Plugin conflicts and updates

🟣 Choose Framer If:

You Prioritize:

  • ✅ Design quality (9.5/10 vs 7-8/10)
  • ✅ Fast load times (1-2s vs 3-5s)
  • ✅ Premium brand positioning
  • ✅ Marketing/portfolio site focus
  • ✅ Modern UI/UX patterns

You Accept:

  • ✅ +33-50% renewal pricing
  • ✅ No WordPress plugin ecosystem
  • ✅ No WooCommerce integration
  • ✅ Limited plugin options
  • ✅ Not for complex applications

FINAL VERDICT: ECOSYSTEM OR DESIGN?

Choose 10Web for WordPress ecosystem. Choose Framer for design quality.

🟢 10Web For:

  • • Ecommerce with WooCommerce
  • • WordPress plugin flexibility
  • • Advanced SEO (Yoast/RankMath)
  • • Existing WordPress migration
  • • Complex site requirements

🟣 Framer For:

  • • Marketing and portfolio sites
  • • Premium design quality
  • • Fast load times (SEO advantage)
  • • Brand credibility
  • • Code export capability

Brutal truth: If you don't need WooCommerce or WordPress plugins, Framer wins

10Web's +200% renewal pricing ($1,560 over 5 years) is hard to justify unless you need WooCommerce.
Framer costs $1,440-2,160 over 5 years but saves you from WordPress maintenance overhead.
Choose based on must-have features, not marketing hype.

TECHNICAL ARCHITECTURE SHOWDOWN:
WORDPRESS AI VS PURE AI-FIRST

ARCHITECTURE DEEP DIVE

10WEB: WORDPRESS-BASED

  • ✓ WordPress ecosystem: 60,000+ plugins available
  • ✓ MySQL database: Traditional WP architecture
  • ✓ PHP-based: Standard WordPress template system
  • ✓ Managed hosting: Google Cloud Platform
  • ✓ AI generates: WordPress themes, Elementor layouts

FRAMER: STANDALONE PLATFORM

  • ✓ React-based: Modern JavaScript framework
  • ✓ Headless CMS: Content API + frontend separation
  • ✓ Global CDN: Cloudflare edge network
  • ✓ AI-native: Built from ground up with AI
  • ✓ AI generates: React components, pages, interactions

PLUGIN ECOSYSTEM VS NATIVE FEATURES

Feature 10Web (Plugins) Framer (Native)
E-commerce WooCommerce (free + extensions) Built-in (Snipcart integration)
Forms WPForms, Gravity Forms (paid) Native form builder (free)
Analytics Google Analytics plugin Native + GA integration
SEO Yoast SEO (free tier available) Built-in SEO controls
Membership MemberPress, Paid Memberships Pro (paid) Not available natively

MIGRATION COMPLEXITY MATRIX

10Web → Framer

Complexity: HIGH

  • • Export WordPress content (XML)
  • • Migrate to Framer CMS manually
  • • Rebuild design (no direct conversion)
  • • Recreate functionality with React
  • • Time: 20-40 hours for typical site
Framer → 10Web

Complexity: VERY HIGH

  • • Export React code (available)
  • • Convert to WordPress theme (PHP)
  • • Rebuild interactions in Elementor
  • • Migrate CMS content to WP posts
  • • Time: 40-80 hours for typical site

CODE EXPORT COMPARISON

10Web Code Export

Output: WordPress theme files (PHP)

Requires WordPress hosting with PHP/MySQL. Includes WordPress template hierarchy, Elementor page builder files, and custom functions.php. Exported code can only run on WordPress infrastructure.

Framer Code Export

Output: React components (JSX)

Modern JavaScript framework code that can deploy anywhere (Vercel, Netlify, custom servers). Includes React components, CSS modules, and can be integrated into any React project. Framework-agnostic deployment options.

TECHNICAL DECISION TREE

Choose 10Web if:
  • • You know WordPress and have existing WP sites
  • • You need plugin ecosystem (60,000+ options)
  • • You have PHP developers or can hire WP devs
  • • You need complex e-commerce (WooCommerce)
  • • You want AI to speed up WP workflow
Choose Framer if:
  • • You want modern React/JavaScript stack
  • • You prefer native features over plugin complexity
  • • You have frontend developers or want to learn React
  • • You prioritize performance and global CDN
  • • You want AI-first design, not WP automation
